verses.text: 信徒的爭執應由教會審判你們中間有人和弟兄起了爭執，怎敢告到不義的人面前，卻不告在聖徒面前呢？

words.note: Lit. 'believing disciple'
Lit. 'teaching assembly'
Commonly refers to fellow believers in biblical context.
Lit. 'holy disciple'

verses.text: 你們不知道聖徒要審判世界嗎？既然世界要由你們來審判，難道你們不配審判這些最小的事嗎？

words.note: Used to introduce a rhetorical question, implying the opposite.

verses.text: 你們不知道我們要審判天使嗎？何況今生的事呢？

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'
Used to emphasize an even stronger case.

verses.text: 你們既然要審判今生的事，為甚麼讓教會不重視的人來審判呢？

words.note: A common interrogative pronoun meaning 'for what reason'.

verses.text: 我說這話，是要使你們羞愧。難道你們中間沒有一個有智慧的人，能夠審判弟兄之間的事嗎？

words.note: Used to introduce a rhetorical question, implying the opposite.

words.definition: to be able to, capable of

words.note: Commonly refers to fellow believers in biblical context.
Literary equivalent of '的' + '中間'

verses.text: 你們竟然是弟兄告弟兄，而且告到不信的人面前去嗎？

words.note: Refers to fellow believers.
Refers to fellow believers.
Refers to non-Christians.

verses.text: 你們彼此告狀，已經是你們的失敗了。為甚麼不寧願受委屈呢？為甚麼不甘心吃虧呢？

words.definition: to file a lawsuit, to accuse

verses.text: 但你們反倒使人受委屈，叫人吃虧，而且他們就是你們的弟兄。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers.

verses.text: 你們不知道不義的人不能承受 神的國嗎？不要自欺，無論是行淫亂的、拜偶像的、姦淫的、作孌童的、親男色的、

words.note: Often used in the context of inheriting salvation or kingdom.
A blank space used to show reverence for God/Lord in Chinese Bibles.
Here, refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven.
Refers to various forms of illicit sexual behavior.
Refers to male prostitution or being a catamite.
Literally 'to be intimate with male beauty/sex'.

verses.text: 偷竊的、貪心的、醉酒的、辱罵人的或勒索的，都不能承受 神的國。

words.note: Often used in the context of inheriting salvation or kingdom.
A blank space used to show reverence for God/Lord in Chinese Bibles.
Here, refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven.

verses.text: 你們有些人從前也是這樣的，但現在藉著我們主耶穌基督的名，靠著我們 神的靈，都已經洗淨了，聖潔了，稱義了。

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: 要用身體榮耀 神甚麼事我都可以作，但不是都有益處。甚麼事我都可以作，但我不要受任何事的轄制。

words.definition: do not want to, must not

words.note: Often implies restrictive control or bondage.

verses.text: 食物是為了肚腹，肚腹是為了食物；但 神卻要把這兩樣都廢掉。身體不是為了淫亂，而是為了主，主也是為了身體。

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to
for the sake of, in order to

words.note: Grammatical particle that moves the object before the verb.

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to
for the sake of, in order to
for the sake of, in order to

verses.text: 神不但使主復活了，也要用他的能力使我們復活。
你們不知道你們的身體就是基督的肢體嗎？這樣，我們可以把基督的肢體當作娼妓的肢體嗎？當然不可以！

words.note: Grammatical particle that moves the object before the verb.

verses.text: 你們不知道那跟娼妓苟合的，就是與她成為一體了嗎？因為經上說：「二人要成為一體。」

words.note: A formal term for prostitute, often used in biblical/moral contexts.
Lit. 'improper union', implies sexual immorality.
A theological concept of unity, especially in marriage or spiritual union.
Refers to written scripture, often the Bible.
A theological concept of unity, especially in marriage or spiritual union.

verses.text: 但那與主聯合的，就是與他成為一靈了。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus Christ.
Refers to a spiritual unity.

verses.text: 你們要逃避淫亂的事。人所犯的，無論是甚麼罪，都是在身體以外，唯有行淫亂的，是觸犯自己的身體。

words.note: Often refers to various forms of sexual sin.
Similar to '只有' but often used in more formal/literary contexts.
Combines 'to do' with 'sexual immorality'.

verses.text: 你們不知道你們的身體就是那位住在你們裡面的聖靈的殿嗎？這聖靈是你們從 神那裡領受的。你們不是屬於自己的，

words.note: Refers to the third person of the Trinity.
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.
The superscript square is a reverence marker in some Bible editions.

verses.text: 因為你們是用重價買來的。所以你們務要用自己的身體榮耀 神。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to refer to the cost of redemption.
Emphatic form of '要', meaning 'definitely must'.
Often used in religious contexts.
The superscript square is a reverence marker in some Bible editions.
